chinese: [C] a pilot 飞机驾驶员；飞行员
examples: e.g. Amy Johnson was a pioneering [[aviator]] who made record-breaking flights to Australia and South Africa in the 1930s.

chinese: [C] (pl. aircraft) a plane or other vehicle that can fly 飞机；航空器；飞行器
examples: e.g. Commercial airlines often find it cheaper to park their [[aircraft]] at a storage facility than at an airport.

chinese: popular, esp. for a short period of time （尤指短期内）时髦的，流行的
examples: e.g. Reading has become the [[fashionable]] educational activity for summer months with schools and libraries running reading challenges.

chinese: having no purpose or importance and therefore not worth doing or having 无目的的；无意义的；无价值的；不重要的
examples: e.g. He said a few [[meaningless]] words to his hostess and looked around the room.

chinese: designed to be useful rather than beautiful or attractive 实用的
examples: e.g. Their tips provide guidance to anyone looking to set up a smart and [[functional]] workspace at home.

chinese: 1) [usu. pl.] sth. such as a bag, belt, or jewelry that you wear or carry because it is attractive 装饰物，小配件（如手袋、皮带、珠宝等）
examples: e.g. This store offers a wide range of clothing, shoes, and [[accessories]] for men, women, and children.；e.g. [[Accessories]] such as a carrying case and a battery recharger are free with the purchase of a cell phone.

chinese: 2) [usu. pl.] sth. such as a piece of equipment or a decoration that is not necessary, but that makes a machine, car, room, etc. more useful or more attractive 附件；配件；附属品
examples: e.g. This store offers a wide range of clothing, shoes, and [[accessories]] for men, women, and children.；e.g. [[Accessories]] such as a carrying case and a battery recharger are free with the purchase of a cell phone.

chinese: [U] (fml.) clothes 衣服
examples: e.g. They specialize in the supply of sports [[apparel]] such as sweatshirts and baseball caps to retail markets.

chinese: (fml.) not noticed 不受注意的；未被注意的
examples: e.g. There are many brave and admirable social workers doing [[unremarked]] work across the nation.

chinese: (usu. passive) live in an area 居住于
examples: e.g. The world's largest iceberg would possibly crash into an island [[populated]] by penguins and seals.

chinese: [U] the act of including sb. / sth. in a larger group or set, or the fact of being included in one 包含；包括
examples: e.g. Evidence is needed to prove that the word has been used in a variety of different sources before it can be considered for [[inclusion]] in one of the dictionaries.

chinese: 1) very 十分
examples: e.g. She is planning to travel to [[distinctly]] different destinations in pursuit of happiness and vision.；e.g. I [[distinctly]] remember asking him not to tell her about the new sales figures.

chinese: 2) clearly 清楚地；明显地
examples: e.g. She is planning to travel to [[distinctly]] different destinations in pursuit of happiness and vision.；e.g. I [[distinctly]] remember asking him not to tell her about the new sales figures.

chinese: vt.make a complete list of all the things in a group 为···编目录；把···列入目录中
examples: e.g. The works came to light during the 1950s, when they were [[catalogued]] in the museum's collection.；e.g. She uses an online [[catalogue]] to search for items by price or country, instead of the hard copies traditionally taken to auctions (拍卖会).

chinese: n.[C] a complete list of things that you can look at, buy, or use, for example in a library or at an art show 目录
examples: e.g. The works came to light during the 1950s, when they were [[catalogued]] in the museum's collection.；e.g. She uses an online [[catalogue]] to search for items by price or country, instead of the hard copies traditionally taken to auctions (拍卖会).

chinese: choose and organize the art, music, objects, etc. for an exhibition, show, concert, etc. 策划组织（展览、表演、音乐会等）
examples: e.g. Focused on artwork inspired by nature, this exhibition is [[curated]] by four high school students.

chinese: (fml.) (be ~ of sth.) completely lacking in sth. 毫无某物；完全没有某物
examples: e.g. Milly is the most serious person I know — her stories are always completely [[devoid]] of humor.

chinese: relating to or having an effect on the emotions 情感的
examples: e.g. Studies in this area investigate how objects or messages can arouse [[affective]] reactions.

chinese: carefully cut, print, or write words on sth., esp. on the surface of a stone or coin （尤指在石头或硬币表面）雕刻，印制，题写
examples: e.g. She signed the book and [[inscribed]] the words "with grateful thanks" on it.

chinese: clear enough or definite enough to be easily seen or noticed 确凿的；明显的；实在的
examples: e.g. These fragments provide [[tangible]] evidence for how the city has changed since the 18th century.

chinese: (fml.) combine and form one single group, substance, etc. 联合；合并
examples: e.g. His sporting and literary interests [[coalesced]] admirably in his writing about climbing.

chinese: (AmE fiber)1) [C, U] （用来做绳子、布等的）纤维
2) [U] （植物的）纤维，食物纤维
[C] a short piece of thread that has been sewn into a piece of cloth, or the action of the thread going into and out of the cloth （缝纫中的）一针；缝
examples: e.g. You'd better put a [[stitch]] in the corner of the pocket to keep it in place.

chinese: [U] the feeling people have that they are members of a group in society and that they share particular qualities with other members of that group 相互联系；社会关系
examples: e.g. Human beings have a need for both independence and [[connectedness]].

chinese: extremely valuable or important 极其贵重的；极其重要的
examples: e.g. Her knowledge and experience would make her a [[priceless]] asset to the team.

chinese: 1) the act of preventing sth. from being lost, wasted, damaged or destroyed 保存；保护；节约
examples: e.g. The project includes the [[conservation]] of 200 paintings, 15,000 books and quantities of furniture, ceramics and textiles.；e.g. China is one of the few places in the world where the elephant population is growing thanks to extensive [[conservation]] efforts.

chinese: 2) the protection of natural things such as animals, plants, and forests to prevent them from being spoiled or destroyed （动植物、森林等的）保护
examples: e.g. The project includes the [[conservation]] of 200 paintings, 15,000 books and quantities of furniture, ceramics and textiles.；e.g. China is one of the few places in the world where the elephant population is growing thanks to extensive [[conservation]] efforts.

chinese: record the addition of a new item to a library, museum, etc. 将（图书馆、博物馆等的新书、新展品）登记入册
examples: e.g. Objects will be accepted and [[accessioned]] into the museum's collections when these conditions are met.

chinese: (fml.) (~ upon / on sb. ) necessary as part of sb's duty 有责任的；有义务的；必须履行的
examples: e.g. It is [[incumbent]] upon parents to control what their children watch on TV.

chinese: 1) (fml.) sb. who guards or protects sth. 维护者；保卫者
examples: e.g. These oral historians were the [[guardians]] of traditional values and the teachers of lessons about the natural world.；e.g. The girl's parents or [[guardians]] must give their consent before she has the operation.

chinese: 2) sb. who is legally responsible for looking after sb. else's child, esp. after the child's parents have died 监护人
examples: e.g. These oral historians were the [[guardians]] of traditional values and the teachers of lessons about the natural world.；e.g. The girl's parents or [[guardians]] must give their consent before she has the operation.

chinese: 1) a book that you put photographs, stamps, etc. in （收存照片、邮票等的）簿，册
examples: e.g. We've put the best wedding photos into an [[album]] — do you want to see them?；e.g. The singer talked about the inspiration behind the creation of each track from his newly released [[album]].

chinese: 2) a group of songs or pieces of music on a CD, tape, etc. （歌曲或音乐的）专辑
examples: e.g. We've put the best wedding photos into an [[album]] — do you want to see them?；e.g. The singer talked about the inspiration behind the creation of each track from his newly released [[album]].

chinese: 1) in a way of happening or developing in a natural and continuous process 自然地；持续地
examples: e.g. The company has been growing [[organically]] over the past few years.；e.g. There is firm evidence that [[organically]] grown crops are healthier to eat than conventional ones.

chinese: 2) in a way of growing food without using artificial chemicals 不使用化肥地；有机地；绿色地
examples: e.g. The company has been growing [[organically]] over the past few years.；e.g. There is firm evidence that [[organically]] grown crops are healthier to eat than conventional ones.

chinese: spread over a wide area or over a long period of time 分散的；稀疏的
examples: e.g. The higher cost of providing full services to a [[scattered]] community cannot be ignored.

chinese: [C] a piece of furniture with doors and shelves or drawers, used for storing or showing things （有拉门、搁板或抽屉的）储藏柜，陈列柜
(festivities) [pl.] things such as drinking, eating, or dancing that are done to celebrate a special occasion 庆祝活动；庆典
examples: e.g. This year's [[festivities]] included fireworks, light shows and a live concert at King International Stadium.

chinese: [U] the quality of being unusually good, special or the only one of its kind 不同寻常；独特；独一无二
examples: e.g. It is the [[uniqueness]] of her painting style for which she has been remembered over the past decades.

chinese: [C, U] a long thin string of cotton, silk, etc. used to sew or weave cloth （缝衣服的）线
[C, U] the act or process of repeating 重复
examples: e.g. Companies should focus on customer experiences and strive to improve those experiences through constant [[iteration]].

chinese: with a clear aim or purpose, determinedly 有目的地；有决心地；果断地
examples: e.g. Upon hearing these words, she began walking slowly but [[purposefully]] toward the bridge.

chinese: store or hide sth. 将某物存起来或藏起来
examples: e.g. Every member of the family can now [[tuck]] away either £9 or £18 a month in one of these savings plans.

chinese: in the state of existing 存在
examples: e.g. That's why there are tens of thousands of start-ups in [[existence]] today.

english: it is incumbent upon / on sb. to do sth.
chinese: it is sb's duty or responsibility to do sth. 做某事是某人的职务（责任）
examples: e.g. It is [[incumbent]] upon all users of this equipment to familiarize themselves with the safety procedure.

chinese: die — use this when you want to avoid saying the word "die" 去世；离世
examples: e.g. Stephen Hawking, who is known for his groundbreaking work with black holes and relativity, [[passed]] away at the age of 76.

chinese: 马里奥 • 梅西纳（人名）
